docs.text:
LadeGCM Documentation




Usage




Acknowledging LadeGCM


If you use LadeGCM in your research, please reference this repository and the following article:


Lade et al., 
Earth Systems Dynamics
 
9
, 507
523 (2018) 


DOI: 
10.5194/esd-9-507-2018


@Article{esd-9-507-2018,
AUTHOR = {Lade, S. J. and Donges, J. F. and Fetzer, I. and Anderies, J. M. and Beer, C. and Cornell, S. E. and Gasser, T. and Norberg, J. and Richardson, K. and Rockstr\
om, J. and Steffen, W.},
TITLE = {Analytically tractable climate--carbon cycle feedbacks under 21st century anthropogenic forcing},
JOURNAL = {Earth System Dynamics},
VOLUME = {9},
YEAR = {2018},
NUMBER = {2},
PAGES = {507--523},
URL = {https://www.earth-syst-dynam.net/9/507/2018/},
DOI = {10.5194/esd-9-507-2018}
}

docs.text:
API




LadeGCM.calculate


LadeGCM.generate_emission_parameters


LadeGCM.load_pathway_data


LadeGCM.results




#


LadeGCM.calculate
 
 
Method
.


calculate(RCP45)




Entry point to the module. Will construct all required parameters and solve the DAE.


Any flags you wish to pass to the solver can be added to the end of the call.


calculate(RCP45, reltol=1e-10, abstol=1e-10, saveat=1765:0.1:2100)




Works as expected.


source


#


LadeGCM.generate_emission_parameters
 
 
Method
.


(E, LUC) = generate_emission_parameters(RCP45)




For a given concentration pathway, generate continuous functions for fossil fuel emissions 
E(t)
 and land use emissions 
LUC(t)
.


Data comes from files on disk and is linearly interpolated to provide the continuous output.


source


#


LadeGCM.load_pathway_data
 
 
Method
.


data_frame = load_pathway_data(RCP45)




Loads csv file for a given RCP scenario into a dataframe for processing. The information in these files come from Meinshausen et al. (2011), which were generated using MAGICC6.


source


#


LadeGCM.results
 
 
Method
.


Collects all required outputs from the DAE solution.


source

Will construct all required parameters and solve the DAE.  Any flags you wish to pass to the solver can be added to the end of the call.  calculate(RCP45, reltol=1e-10, abstol=1e-10, saveat=1765:0.1:2100)  Works as expected.  source  #  LadeGCM.generate_emission_parameters     Method .  (E, LUC) = generate_emission_parameters(RCP45)  For a given concentration pathway, generate continuous functions for fossil fuel emissions  E(t)  and land use emissions  LUC(t) .  Data comes from files on disk and is linearly interpolated to provide the continuous output.  source  #  LadeGCM.load_pathway_data     Method .  data_frame = load_pathway_data(RCP45)  Loads csv file for a given RCP scenario into a dataframe for processing. The information in these files come from Meinshausen et al. (2011), which were generated using MAGICC6.  source  #  LadeGCM.results     Method .  Collects all required outputs from the DAE solution.  source
